name: Terrence Kuo
title: Embedded Systems Engineer at Magic Leap
bio: Terrence Kuo is an embedded systems engineer at Magic Leap, the most successful stealth startup in history, raising $1.4 billion in venture funding for its revolutionary augmented reality technology. A graduate of Princeton University’s electrical engineering program, Terrence has experience in both research and applied engineering, with work experience at engineering firms Autodesk and Styrd. Terrence is passionate about access to education and technology, working with the MIT Office of Engineering Outreach to deliver high quality engineering programs for low-income students. Driven by both AMRC’s technological vision and its social mission to bring high-tech opportunity to Northwest Florida, Terrence advises AMRC’s engineering team on design and implementation.
